title: UJ Seuteni
text:
Ulupano Junior Seuteni (born 9 December 1993 in <a href="Adelaide">Adelaide</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>) is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%2313.%20Outside%20centre%20%26amp%3B%2012.%20Inside%20centre">Centre</a> or <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%2315.%20Full-back">Fullback</a> or <a href="Fly-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">fly-half</a> for the <a href="Oyonnax%20Rugby">Oyonnax Rugby</a> in <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>.
Biography.
Seuteni was named in the Extended Playing Squad for the <a href="2012%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2012 Super Rugby season</a> despite being only 17 years old and still in his final year at school. He missed the majority of the season through injury, however he retained his spot in the Reds EPS for the <a href="2013%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2013 season</a>.
He was a member of the <a href="Australia%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia Under 20</a> side which competed in the <a href="2012%20IRB%20Junior%20World%20Championship">2012 IRB Junior World Championship</a> in <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a> where he made 4 appearances and made 2 conversions.
